de.mrapp.android.adapter

Interface SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    All Superinterfaces:
    Adapter<android.widget.ExpandableListView>, java.lang.Cloneable, DataStructure, EnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ExpandableGridViewAdapter, android.widget.ExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableRecyclerViewAdapter, FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, android.widget.HeterogeneousExpandableList, ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, Loggable, Parameterizable, Restorable, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, java.io.Serializable, SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
extends SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary group and child items, of which only one single item can be selected at once, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • isGroupSelected

        boolean isGroupSelected()
        Returns, whether a group item is currently selected, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if a group item is currently selected, false otherwise

      • isChildSelected

        boolean isChildSelected()
        Returns, whether a child item is currently selected, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if a child item is currently selected, false otherwise

      • getSelectedGroupIndex

        int getSelectedGroupIndex()
        Returns the index of the currently selected group item or the index of the group item, the currently selected child belongs to.
        Returns:
        The index of the currently selected group item as an Integer value or -1, if no item is currently selected

      • getSelectedChildIndex

        int getSelectedChildIndex()
        Returns the index of the currently selected child item.
        Returns:
        The index of the currently selected child item as an Integer value or -1, if no child item is currently selected

      • getSelectedGroup

        GroupType getSelectedGroup()
        Returns the currently selected group item.
        Returns:
        The currently selected group item as an instance of the generic type GroupType or null, if no group item is currently selected

      • getSelectedChild

        ChildType getSelectedChild()
        Returns the currently selected child item.
        Returns:
        The currently selected child item as an instance of the generic type ChildType or null, if no child item is currently selected

      • triggerGroupSelection

        boolean triggerGroupSelection(int groupIndex)
        Triggers the selection of the group item, which belongs to a specific index, if it is currently enabled. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected. If the adapter's choice mode does not allow group items to be selected, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose selection should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the group item, which belongs to the given index, has been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerGroupSelection

        boolean triggerGroupSelection(@NonNull
                              GroupType group)
        Triggers the selection of a specific group item, if it is currently enabled. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected. If the adapter's choice mode does not allow group items to be selected, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, whose selection should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The group item may not be null. If the group item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the group item has been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerChildSelection

        boolean triggerChildSelection(@NonNull
                              GroupType group,
                              int childIndex)
        Triggers the selection of the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group if it is currently enabled. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected. If the adapter's choice mode does not allow child items to be selected, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose selection should be triggered, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose selection should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the child item has changed, false otherwise

      • triggerChildSelection

        boolean triggerChildSelection(@NonNull
                              GroupType group,
                              @NonNull
                              ChildType child)
        Triggers the selection of a specific child item of a specific group, if it is currently enabled. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected. If the adapter's choice mode does not allow child items to be selected, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose selection should be triggered, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        child - The child item, whose selection should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child item may not be null. If the child item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True if the selection of the child item has changed, false otherwise

      • triggerChildSelection

        boolean triggerChildSelection(int groupIndex,
                              int childIndex)
        Triggers the selection of the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected. If the adapter's choice mode does not allow child items to be selected, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item, whose selection should be triggered, belongs to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose selection should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(groupIndex):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the child item has changed, false otherwise

      • triggerChildSelection

        boolean triggerChildSelection(int groupIndex,
                              @NonNull
                              ChildType child)
        Triggers the selection of a specific child item of a specific group. If the item is not currently selected, the item becomes selected and any other selected item becomes unselected. If the item is already selected, the item becomes unselected. If the adapter's choice mode does not allow child items to be selected, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item, whose selection should be triggered, belongs to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        child - The child item, whose selection should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child item may not be null. If the child item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the selection of the child item has changed, false otherwise

      • adaptSelectionAutomatically

        void adaptSelectionAutomatically(boolean adaptSelectionAutomatically)
        Sets, whether the adapter's selection should be automatically adapted in order to ensure that an item is always selected if possible, or not. For example this causes the selection to be adapted, when the currently selected item has been removed from the adapter.
        Parameters:
        adaptSelectionAutomatically - True, if the adapter's selection should be automatically adapted, false otherwise

      • isSelectionAdaptedAutomatically

        boolean isSelectionAdaptedAutomatically()
        Returns, whether the adapter's selection is automatically adapted in order to ensure that an item is always selected if possible, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the adapter's selection is automatically adapted, false otherwise
